wikipedia_page.main: William Miller Ord, FRCP (23 September 1834 – 14 May 1902) was a British medical scientist. He was a surgeon at St. Thomas Hospital in London, where he worked for 50 years.

response: It is named after the physician, William Miller Ord, who first described it in 1877 and again in 1888. It is more common among women than men.
